term.title: solvation energy

item.text: The change in Gibbs energy when an ion or molecule is transferred from a vacuum (or the gas phase) to a solvent. The main contributions to the solvation energy come from: the cavitation energy of formation of the hole which preserves the dissolved species in the solvent; the orientation energy of partial orientation of the dipoles; the isotropic interaction energy of electrostatic and dispersion origin; and the anisotropic energy of specific interactions, e.g. hydrogen bonds, donor-acceptor interactions etc.
